page.title: 01Clachamish to Braebost
page.content: Main A850 road goes through this area. Recently upgraded and a new two lane section built replacing old single track. Number of small townships. Land is set out in regular shaped plots called crofts, many with a modern house. Two old houses - one uninhabited. Lyndale house is surrounded by fairly fertile farmland (for Skye) and supports a large sheep population. Much of the area is rough grazing, moorland and peat cuttings - ie areas where peat turfs are cut and then dried for winter fuel. both of the older houses are surrounded by woodland. Loch Snizort Beag lies to the east. Grounds of Lyndale House often used as a clay pigeon shoot. Working adults rely on more than one occupation - crofting (farming) being the secondary. Much Bed & Breakfast occupation in the summer for visitors.
